entry.title: Add features, switch, and flag for improved download warnings
entry.content:
This CL:



1. Adds 2 base::Features for improved download warnings on the download

bubble and the download page, for which implementation is about to

begin.

2. Adds a chrome switch called --enable-download-warning-improvements.

3. Adds a chrome://flags entry called #download-warning-improvements,

which controls the above switch.

4. Hooks up the switch to override the newly added features, as well as

existing features related to downloads and download warnings.



The purpose of steps 2-4 is to make it easier for testers to turn on

a related set of changes.



Bug: 1465966

Change-Id: I5bf4a23945c0180c24a4f88b4089eb3f5af68e9e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698495

entry.title: Fix parsing of comma-separated lists in custom property declarations
entry.content:
The current implementation doesn't check `AtEnd()` when parsing comma-

separated lists, which incorrectly lets space-separated lists pass

parsing because the first component still parses.



This patch fixes it.



Fixed: 1466680

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Smooth scroll-in upon autotriggering
entry.content:
When Page Insight sheet is auto-triggered, make it scroll in together

with the browser controls rather than having it pop up after the browser

controls finished scrolling in. This makes the UI looks smoother.



Page Insight sheet will be opened but will stay invisible until

the browser controls are moved back into the screen.

entry.title: Revert "Allows a window to take app list bubble focus without hiding it"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 933fc835d587ad3ad030f2d70936e26b9ff7bf73.



Reason for revert:



After discussion with dmblack@, we are okay to allow all children

of the help bubble container to keep app list bubble show without

focus. Therefore, the window property added by

this CL is not needed anymore.



Original change's description:

> Allows a window to take app list bubble focus without hiding it

>

> This CL creates a window property key that allows a window with this

> key to take focus from the app list bubble without hiding the bubble.

> This key will be used by the Welcome Tour help bubble.

>

> This CL does not use this newly created property key in the product

> code. Therefore, this CL should not bring any noticeable differences

> to product.

>

entry.title: Make search bar taller if the preset height is not enough
entry.content:
The default height for the search bar is set at 70dp[1], which is

typically sufficient. However, in cases where the font is scaled, it

can sometimes become too short. Therefore, this CL will determine the

minimum height required to display the font and, if the minimum height

exceeds 70dp, it will be used instead.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/67mifgv9mtvfXdt

After : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7BGdkjaK6ju89iq



[1]:https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/res/values/dimens.xml;l=66?q=overlay_panel_bar_height%20-f:Debug&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



Bug: 1416667

Change-Id: I407817f2815ea2a37e3dd89479c2c90cca7ee169

> Reviewed-by: Yaron Friedman

> Commit-Queue: Michael Thiessen

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171720}





Revert "Allow CCT/TWAs to bypass gesture requirement when returning to client"



This reverts commit f7fe1b9a0e644df17a5981e61e7f548de29e159b.



Reason for revert: Conflict with crbug/1467532 - easy to bring back after



Original change's description:

> Allow CCT/TWAs to bypass gesture requirement when returning to client

>

> Custom Tabs and TWAs are often used for things like sign-on, where the

> CCT/TWA is opened, then redirects back to the client. We fairly

> recently added a 15 second timeout on navigation chains so that users

> wouldn't be surprised by inactive tabs redirecting to apps. However,

> this lead to flakiness in some CCT/TWA users as in some enterprise

> scenarios login redirect chains can frequently take more than 15

> seconds to complete.

>

> Given the user is redirecting back to the app that opened the CCT/TWA

> the abuse vector is very limited (requires the user to use a malicious

> app), the user gesture/15 second timeout isn't very strong protection

> to begin with, and the user probably expects to be returned to the app

> that opened the tab, I think we can lift the restriction for this case.

>

> Bug: 1464549

entry.title: [User Education] Allow multiple annotations on a menu
entry.content:
Help bubbles attached to menus are considered "annotations" and handled

by a special event-forwarding system to allow closing the help bubble

via mouse when the menu is showing (otherwise, the menu would lose focus

and disappear).



This was implemented assuming only a single help bubble attached to any

given menu, but with tutorials that can attach to submenus, there can

briefly be two simultaneous help bubbles, breaking this assumption.



Now menus may have any number of annotations; events will be sent to

each in turn, and the first one that reports that it handles the event

will take precedence.



This CL mostly changes from using a WeakAutoReset to a

CallbackListSubscription, which is a more natural return value for

adding an annotation callback anyway. A test is added to make sure that

the double-bubble actually works.



Change-Id: I5e49ae283832957f9e969a8266de07bea8096563

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Handle simple End-of-Stream (a.k.a. Drain or Flush)
entry.content:
This CL adds handling the end_of_stream() buffer, by initiating the

V4L2 Drain procedure [1]. Note how the |decode_cb| associated with

that Decode() call has to be kept around until after the Drain is

finished.



The code includes sending a V4L2_DEC_CMD_STOP to the queue, which is

also done in V4L2StatefulVideoDecoderBackend, so all of that is put

into a new function in v4l2_utils.cc.



With this CL the v_d_a_tests FlushAtEndOfStream passes (concretely

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests

/usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8

--vmodule=v4l2_stateful_video_decoder=3,*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=1,=0,video_decoder_pipeline=3

--enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder

--gtest_filter='*.FlushAtEndOfStream' )



[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/v5.15/userspace-api/media/v4l/dev-decoder.html#drain



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: I11da082484bdb0334ef25fad5261e15ed57971db

entry.title: Remove RunScript helper and simplify test helpers
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes:

* Removes `RunScript` in favor of just calling EvalJs directly in

tests. This makes the test behavior slightly more straightforward.

* Removes `PopConsole`, since it's a trivial wrapper around

PopConsoleString, and the callsites are clearer without the wrapper.

* Moves EXPECT_* calls into the bodies of the helpers that are never

expected to fail. This makes the tests a bit less "noisy", and makes

it impossible for a test to forget to check the assertion.

* Replaces EXPECT_TRUE(x == y) with EXPECT_EQ(x, y). This lets the

test give better error messages in the event of a failure.



Change-Id: I0d0aae2af950359f277c58080777a4f3b0dc99f1

entry.title: [Private Network Access] Use initiator policies for nested navigations.
entry.content:
This change fixes a longstanding bug in the PNA implementation for

iframes. PNA checks apply to the fetch client's policies, not the

parent frame's policies.



Also introduce a couple new feature flags to control the rollout of

PNA for iframes: warning-only mode and full enforcement. These replace

the previous feature flag, which only applied to non-secure contexts.



The feature flag checking logic is moved to live inside

`DerivePrivateNetworkRequestPolicy()`, as is the case for worker flags.



A couple virtual test suites are introduced to exercise the code paths

behind the two new flags. These show that there remain bugs when the

feature is entirely enabled: preflight requests do not succeed. This

seems to be due to a strange interaction of CORS logic with PNA, where

navigation requests are made in no-cors mode with credentials. Further

work is needed to fix this, either by fixing the tests or by fixing

CORS logic.



Bug: chromium:1170335

Change-Id: Iea67b39c46ff48edac3f51e9ccc63d4bac47b7e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3945088

Auto-Submit: Titouan Rigoudy

entry.title: [Privacy Hub] Limit notification message to 150 characters
entry.content:
A notification preview can show at most ~170 characters. Since app names

may be long we could run out of space towards the end of the

notification message and it would be cut off. The font used isn't

monospaced and we want to be cautious and limit the notification to 150

characters by showing the generic notification message without any

app names if we exceed the limit.

entry.title: ipcz: Fix stalling proxy bypass
entry.content:
Due to a trivial logic inversion bug, if we need to allocate a new

RouterLinkState at a certain stage of the proxy bypass flow, the bypass

will stall out with the central link stuck in a locked state.



A pipe stuck in this state can never communicate endpoint closure from

one end to the other and can never eliminate proxies which accumulate

along its route. The net result is probably bad performance, and

definitely soft pipe leaks and other application-level stalling

behavior (see linked fetch bug).



Fixed: 1426471

Change-Id: I6541f9d9cb2c735dc153393b3fd5fe2fd788a4c3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708353

entry.title: Prefetch teacher glanceables data soon after login
entry.content:
Starts a timer to fetch teacher data after classroom glanceables client

get created (which happens on login, if glanceables are enabled for the

user). The purpose is to initialize submissions state for teacher's

course work items early, to make data fetch when the glanceable is first

shown faster (as older course work items would not need to be refetched).



The timer is fired few minutes after log in, to avoid increasing already

heavy load immediately after log in.



BUG=b:283371186

entry.title: [cc/tiles] Add a feature to reclaim prepaint tiles after 30s
entry.content:
Tiles in the EVENTUALLY priority bin are out of the viewport, and out of

the skewport. In other words, they wouldn't be pre-rasterized if the

page was loaded from scratch. This means that they represent content

that has been seen, and can be scrolled back to, maybe.



Some browser windows stay visible for hours, without ever being

scrolled. In this case, tiles in the EVENTUALLY region (i.e., far from

the viewport) are less interesting to keep around.



This CL adds a feature to reclaim tiles in this region after 30s. The

reclaiming task does not depend on frame production (thus catching idle

windows), and does not recur when no progress can be made (to avoid

wasting CPU time).



Locally, it saves 10s of MiB of memory on a simple static webpage, (well, simple... the HTML5 spec,

https://www.w3.org/TR/2011/WD-html5-20110405/) when it is scrolled

then left alone.



Bug: 1459256

Change-Id: I528f9957a34c251bae68c6683d13d04aad5be5e7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705445

entry.title: arc-a11y: Speculative crash fix by observing notification window
entry.content:
From the stacktrace of the crash, it's likely that we're accessing a

dangling pointer of aura::Window stored in AXTreeSourceAndroid.



For notification windows, we currently clear the reference to the window

when its surface is removed. It's not sure if there's any timing when

the the surface hasn't been removed yet but the window is already

destroyed.



It is safe to clear the pointer before the window is destroyed so that the

invalid pointer won't be accessed.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.



Bug: b/288639478

Test: unit_tests

entry.title: [text-autospace] Fix optimization logic
entry.content:
The previous optimization logic using the Unicode script may

fail to apply necessary auto-spacing, because some code points

have `COMMON` or `INHERITED`, whose script will be copied from

their previous characters[1].



This patch fixes the logic by checking such code points and

skipping the optimized code path.



This patch has no behavior changes as all changes are under a

runtime flag.



[1] https://util.unicode.org/UnicodeJsps/list-unicodeset.jsp?a=%5B%5B%3Ablk%3D%2F%5E%28Hiragana%7CKatakana%29%24%2F%3A%5D%26%5B%3Agc%21%3D%2F%5EP%2F%3A%5D%5D%5B%3Ablk%3D%2F%5E%28CJK_Strokes%7CKatakana_Ext%29%24%2F%3A%5D&g=sc&i=

entry.title: [PaymentHandler] Always refresh icon for service worker payment apps
entry.content:
When a PaymentRequest is made for a service worker app that is already

installed on the device, SelfDeletingServiceWorkerPaymentAppFinder

would skip crawling for this app entirely. This means that nothing in

the web-app manifest can ever be updated - the icon, the delegations,

etc.



This CL fixes the icon case, by always crawling for updated icons,

even if an app is already installed. To do so it utilizes the existing

CrawlingMode::kMissingIconRefetch mode of the underlying

InstallablePaymentAppCrawler. The refetch crawl is done asynchronously

from returning the found apps, because waiting for the crawl imposes

a user-visible latency on loading the payment app.



The change is implemented behind a default-enabled flag,

kPaymentHandlerAlwaysRefreshIcon, as we view this change as a bug-fix.

The flag is used so that we can turn it off server-side if any

problems come up.



One possible area left for optimization: currently this CL always

downloads and overwrites the payment app icon every instantiation,

even if it is identical to what is already stored for the app. This

will hit the HTTP cache for repeated calls, but could probably be

improved to only redownload every so often or if the URL changed, etc.



Bug: 1421326

entry.title: 🧑‍🌾 Revert "[DownloadBubble] Fix notification behavior for Lacros tab fullscreen"
entry.content:
This reverts commit cc3a8e9efbafefa405012d6d3d16c97da0a97a54.



Reason for revert: Test failures on Mac10.15



https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac10.15%20Tests/40424/overview



native_widget_ns_window_bridge.mm(1697): Check failed: child_count == child_windows_.size() (2 vs. 3)



[ RUN ] DownloadBubbleInteractiveUiTest.DownloadBubbleDetailsShownAfterImmersiveFullscreenDownload/1

[78348:775:0724/172301.663884:WARNING:chrome_main_delegate.cc(610)] This is Chrome version 117.0.5909.0 (not a warning)

[78348:775:0724/172301.694423:WARNING:policy_logger.cc(148)] :components/enterprise/browser/controller/chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(88) Could not create policy manager as CBCM is not enabled.

[78348:775:0724/172301.696145:WARNING:field_trial_util.cc(104)] Field trial config study skipped: DownloadUXRedesign.Enabled_New_20220816 (some of its features are already overridden)

[78348:775:0724/172301.696693:WARNING:field_trial_util.cc(104)] Field trial config study skipped: PreconnectToSearchDesktop.EnabledWithStartupDelayForegroundOnly (some of its features are already overridden)

[78348:775:0724/172301.749140:ERROR:policy_logger.cc(154)] :components/enterprise/browser/controller/chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(163) Cloud management controller initialization aborted as CBCM is not enabled.

[78348:27139:0724/172304.111115:WARNING:quarantine_mac.mm(71)] MDItemCreate failed for path /opt/s/w/itkvpcvehv/.org.chromium.Chromium.znu1cd/download-test1.lib

../../ui/base/interaction/interactive_test_internal.cc:151: Failure

Failed

Interactive test failed on step 8 (Check("Exclusive access bubble is not displayed")) with reason kFailedForTesting; step type kShown; id ElementIdentifier 4613241680 [kInteractiveTestPivotElementId]; element 0x138022b4a80



Original change's description:

> [DownloadBubble] Fix notification behavior for Lacros tab fullscreen

>

> There are two types of fullscreen, browser fullscreen (where the whole

> browser is fullscreen), and tab fullscreen (where an element on the web

> page requests fullscreen). Before this patch, the behavior of browser

> fullscreen downloads is that we show an exclusive access bubble with

> wording instructing the user to exit fullscreen to view their downloads,

> and then show the partial view upon exiting fullscreen. When not in

> immersive fullscreen mode, tab fullscreen should work the same way.

> However, this was not working properly in tab fullscreen on Lacros,

> where the exclusive access bubble was not being shown.

>

> The issue was that we were passing an empty GURL to the exclusive access

> context, which signifies browser (immersive on ChromeOS) fullscreen.

> Since we always pass an empty GURL when notify_download is true, the

> fix in this CL is to modify the logic in BrowserView so that the check

> for a non-empty URL is skipped for notify_download == true. The logic

> for immersive fullscreen is handled already by the download controller

> anyway.

>

> Also adds interactive UI tests for both browser and tab fullscreen.

>

> Bug: 1361511

entry.title: [webrtc-internals] Clear old 'metrics: value' from stats tables.
entry.content:
It is perfectly valid for metrics to change from a defined value to the

undefined value. For example, some encoder implementations report a

scalabilityMode and others do not (scalabilityMode is undefined).



Because webrtc-internals was only updating metrics that had a value

this resulted in what looked like invalid encoder implementation and

scalability mode combinations, causing much confusion.



This CL fixes that problem by taking all previously reported metrics

that are now undefined and changing their obsolete values to

"(removed)".



This CL also ensures that the "Stats graphs" title (containing

information such as scalabilityMode and encoderImplementation) is made

up-to-date.



Bug: 1467461

Change-Id: Ifbe748dad4c9be58d3d178d7dae3c7c2154dfa67

entry.title: graphite: Remove CopySrc usage for multiplanar textures
entry.content:
Most Dawn backends don't support CopySrc usage for multiplanar textures,

and specifying it for texture usage can cause mismatches e.g. with

D3DImageBacking::GetAllowedDawnUsages.

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Fix dangling pointer in WebSocket
entry.content:
HttpServer should outlive Connection/WebSocket, sometimes it is the

case, thus the pointer to HttpServer is dangling:

1. HttpServer::Close() destroys Connection, but not in the current task.

2. HttpServer::Close() calls Delegate::OnClose(), there is a codepath

that destroy HttpServer immediately.



To mitigate dangling ptr, this CL:

1. Updates DevtoolsServer, to ensure that HttpServer (and DevtoolsServer

itself), are not destroyed immediately, but in a posted task.

2. Reorder DeleteSoon(connection) and Delegate::OnClose() calls, to

ensure that task, that deletes connection handled before HttpServer

deletion.



Bug: 1462086

Change-Id: If846e1986273650cbc7d9ff19269ade303c4b723

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705390

Reviewed-by: Matt Menke

Reviewed-by: Leonard Grey

Commit-Queue: Maksim Moskvitin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1174747}
